properties.name: YHA Alfriston

The barn has been featured on BBC's Countryfile and is convenient for visiting Alton Towers and the historic houses in the area. The barn has no electricity, but there's a new wood burning stove for those chilly evenings. There's a communal cooking area with picnic bench seating, toilet, washbasin and a separate sleeping area upstairs.

properties.name: Chipping Camping Barn

The area is great for activity breaks; fell walking, cycling, orienteering and fishing are all nearby. Blackpool is only 45 minutes away, Lancaster is 18 miles and there are plenty of other attractions for a good day out. The sleeping area, toilets and shower are on the first floor with more toilets next door in the former pig sty. The barn has a dining area and separate kitchen and a dryer is available on request. There's even a recreation and children's play area outside for younger members to burn off some energy and a BBQ area if the weather is good! Breakfast is available from the farmhouse if booked in advance. Dogs and tents by arrangement. This barn is perfect for walking and cycling holidays and activity breaks.

properties.address: Castell Mawr, Trefasser, Goodwick, Pembrokeshire, SA64 0LR

properties.name: YHA Ravenstor
properties.description: Enjoy a family weekend break at this lovely country retreat. YHA Ravenstor is a National Trust property set in 60 acres of grounds with stunning views over the Peak District National Park. A great base for walking holidays, activity breaks and visiting Peak District attractions.
properties.address: Millers Dale, Buxton, Derbyshire, SK17 8SS

properties.name: YHA Rhossili Bunkhouse
properties.description: The perfect place to come back to after an active day. YHA Rhossili offers an excellent location for groups exploring the Gower Peninsula and gives great access to nearby surfing beaches.
properties.address: Rhossili Activity Centre, Middleton, Rhossili, Swansea, SA3 1PJ

properties.name: YHA Rowen
properties.description: It's a steep walk to this traditional Welsh hill farmhouse, but you'll be rewarded with a charming rustic welcome and a roaring open fire. The hostel has breathtaking views over the Conwy Valley and across to Snowdonia, a perfect base for walking holidays and activity breaks.
properties.address: Rhiw Farm, Rowen, Conwy, LL32 8YW

properties.name: YHA Salisbury
properties.description: YHA Salisbury is a listed building just a short walk from the historic city of Salisbury and nine miles from Stonehenge. The accommodation is great for exploring the beautiful Wiltshire countryside and its historic sites on a cheap family break or school trip.
properties.address: Milford Hill, Salisbury, Wiltshire, SP1 2QW

properties.name: YHA Scarborough
properties.description: Scarborough Youth Hostel is located beside Scalby Beck, two miles north of the town centre on the A165 to Whitby. After the total service station, go down the hill, around the bend and over the bridge. The entrance to Scarborough Youth Hostel is a very sharp turn, immediately after the bridge.
properties.address: The White House, Burniston Road, Scarborough, North Yorkshire, YO13 0DA

properties.name: YHA Sheen Bunkhouse
properties.description: If you're looking for a bunkhouse break or group holiday, this converted barn is conveniently located for a Peak District activity break, or for exploring the market towns of Buxton, Bakewell, Ashbourne and Leek. It’s also great walking holiday territory, and within easy reach of Alton Towers.
properties.address: Peakstones, Sheen, Derbyshire, SK17 0ES

properties.name: YHA Sheringham
properties.description: There’s so much to see and do here! big blue skies and wide open award-winning beaches, seal trips, steam railways, National Trust properties, world renowned bird Reserves, boat hire on the Broads, all easily accessible without the need for a car. Perfect for a seaside break.
properties.address: 1 Cremer's Drift, Sheringham, Norfolk, NR26 8HX

properties.name: YHA Sherwood Forest
properties.description: Remind yourself of the legend of Robin Hood! Stay at this modern hostel accommodation and enjoy Sherwood Forest and the famous Major Oak just a short walk away, perfect for cheap family breaks, walking holidays, cycling holidays and other activity breaks.
properties.address: Forest Corner, Edwinstowe, Notts, NG21 9RN

properties.name: YHA Skiddaw Bunkhouse
properties.description: A real rural retreat set deep in the heart of the Lake District, the perfect spot for activity breaks and great walking and cycling holidays. It's a 3.5 mile walk to this Cumbria Way accommodation, the perfect chance to admire the breathtaking views that Skiddaw has to offer.
properties.address: Bassenthwaite, Keswick, Cumbria, CA12 4QX

properties.name: YHA Slaidburn
properties.description: Spend gentle, relaxing days exploring the quiet fells and valleys and return to the hostel for a warm welcome and good quality accommodation.
properties.address: King's House, Slaidburn, Clitheroe, Lancashire, BB7 3ER

properties.name: YHA Slimbridge
properties.description: Situated in the south west, within close distance of the Slimbridge Wetland Centre, Berkley Castle and Westonburt Arboretum a comfortable home from home.
properties.address:
The Wild Goose Lodge,
Shepherds Patch,
Slimbridge,
GL2 7BP

properties.name: YHA Snowdon Pen-y-Pass
properties.description: If you're planning to take your holidays in Snowdonia, why not stay at the Snowdon base camp! Once the haunt of famed Victorian climbers, what could be better than this hostel 1,000ft above sea level and at the start the ascent of Snowdon. A great base to experience the stunning landscape and delights that Snowdonia has to offer, from activity breaks and challenging walking holidays to family breaks. Climbing Mount Snowdon can be a life affirming moment – and it’s on your doorstep at YHA Snowdon Pen-y-Pass!
properties.address: Pen-y-Pass, Nantgwynant, Caernarfon, Gwynedd, LL55 4NY

properties.name: YHA Snowdon Ranger
properties.description: Set off to tackle Snowdon from this comfortable rural retreat, with a path to the summit starting from the door. There are plenty of other mountains, lakes and valleys to explore on your walking or hiking holiday in Snowdonia. In summer, you can even swim in the lake from our own beach!
properties.address: Rhyd Ddu, Caernarfon, Gwynedd, LL54 7YS

properties.name: YHA South Downs
properties.description: South Downs YHA is ideal for family and group breaks. The rolling hills of the South Downs surround you with cultural and historic towns and cities very nearby.
properties.address:
Itford Farm,
Beddingham,
Lewes,
East Sussex,
BN8 6JS

properties.name: YHA St Briavels Castle
properties.description: History comes to life in this moated Norman castle. Once the hunting lodge of King John, St Briavels is a perfect base for exploring the Forest of Dean and Monmouthshire. Your accommodation is in the castle itself, so it's a great choice for family breaks and school trips.
properties.address: St Briavels, Lydney, Gloucestershire, GL15 6RG

properties.name: YHA St Davids
properties.description: Whether you’re looking for a land based activity break or watersports challenge, fun for the kids on a cheap family holiday, or simply explore this stunning part of Pembrokeshire at a pace that suits you, this rural retreat at Whitesands Bay is perfect.
properties.address: Llaethdy, Whitesands, St David's, Pembrokeshire, SA62 6PR

properties.name: YHA Stour Valley Bunkhouse
properties.description: The beautiful, undulating Stour Valley offers plenty to do for family groups, walkers, cyclists or a hen party with a difference! Visit Flatford Mill, bring a bike and follow the Painters Trail, or walk the Coastal Path and stop for a delicious......
properties.address: Brantham Hall, The Chase, Brantham, Nr Manningtee, Suffolk, CO11 1PT

properties.name: YHA Stow on the Wold
properties.description: If you’re looking for a family holiday in the Cotswolds, this 17th century townhouse in the charming town of Stow on the Wold is ideal for a weekend or activity break.
properties.address: The Square, Stow-on-the-Wold, Gloucestershire, GL54 1AF

properties.name: YHA Stratford-upon-Avon
properties.description: All you need for a cultural break, school trip or cheap family holiday just two miles from Stratford-upon-Avon, Shakespeare’s birthplace. This magnificent Georgian mansion is set in three acres of grounds and is a great base for visiting Warwick Castle and historic Stratford-upon-Avon - perfect for a weekend break. Anyone who loves rowing, walking or cycling holidays will really appreciate the location of YHA Stratford-upon-Avon.
properties.address: Hemmingford House, Alveston, Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire, CV37 7RG

properties.name: YHA Streatley
properties.description: A great place for a family weekend, with plenty of fun-packed attractions nearby for educational trips or activity breaks in the South East. This comfortable Victorian house is in one of the prettiest villages of the River Thames. Anyone who enjoys walking, cycling and rowing holidays will love its location too.
properties.address: Reading Road, Streatley, Berkshire, RG8 9JJ

properties.name: YHA Street
properties.description: Whether you’re coming for myth and mystery or outlet shopping, this hostel on National Trust land is perfect for exploring this special part of Somerset. Overlooking Glastonbury Tor, this Swiss style chalet is close to the Mendip Hills, great for a walking or cycling activity break.
properties.address: The Chalet, Ivythorn Hill, Street, Somerset, BA16 0TZ

properties.name: YHA Swanage
properties.description: This traditional seaside villa overlooking the sparkling blue waters of Swanage Bay, provides comfortable Jurassic Coast accommodation, popular with families and school trips. The hostel is minutes from a safe sandy beach for a family seaside break, a steam railway, the town centre and stunning cliff top walks if you're looking for activity breaks.
properties.address: Cluny, Cluny Crescent, Swanage, Dorset, BH19 2BS

properties.name: YHA Swansea Bunkhouse
properties.description: This groups only accommodation, is on the outskirts of Mumbles village, with the stunning Gower Peninsula just around the headland and a sandy beach two minutes walk away. Great for children and young people.
properties.address: Dan-y-Coed House, Huntington Close, West Cross, Swansea, SA3 5AL

properties.name: Taddington Camping Barn
properties.description: The barn is in the centre of the village of Taddington, at over 1,000 ft, midway between the market towns of Buxton and Bakewell. Surrounded by limestone hills and dales, there are excellent walks and fine views in all directions - perfect for walking holidays. There are tables and benches in the communal area, a cooking area, toilets and a shower.
properties.address: The Woodlands, Taddington, Buxton, Derbyshire, SK17 9UD

properties.name: YHA Tanners Hatch
properties.description: A great location to let the kids run free or to escape and enjoy a walking holiday or activity break in the Surrey Hills. The hostel is a lovely country retreat in National Trust woodland near historic Polesden Lacey. After a day exploring, come back and relax in the hostel’s cosy surroundings.
properties.address: off Ranmore Common Road, Dorking, Surrey, RH5 6BE

properties.name: YHA Telscombe
properties.description: Telscombe is a lovely base for a cheap family holiday and anyone looking for peace and quiet. It's good for activity breaks too, with plenty of opportunity to explore the South Downs, the cliffs of the south coast and Virginia Woolf’s house.
properties.address: Bank Cottages, Telscombe, Lewes, East Sussex, BN7 3HZ

properties.name: YHA Thurlby
properties.description: Enjoy a few days of village life in this small hostel. It provides a lovely quiet retreat, whether you spend your days being active or exploring the churches and market towns of the area.
properties.address: 16 High Street, Thurlby, Bourne, Lincolnshire, PE10 0EE

properties.name: YHA Tintagel
properties.description: With the sound of the waves crashing against rocks, the salty sea air and the wind in your hair – this is the place to soak up the special atmosphere of Cornwall's mythical Tintagel - great for a memorable family holiday. Close to lots of walking and cycling paths, this wild, remote cliff-top retreat has stunning coastal views and glorious sunsets to tempt you back to the hostel.
properties.address: Dunderhole Point, Tintagel, Cornwall, PL34 0DW

properties.name: Trawden Camping Barn
properties.description: This converted barn is in an idyllic setting surrounded by meadows, 1 mile from Trawden village. There are plenty of opportunities for walking in the Forest of Trawden and on the South Pennine moors. The barn has a sleeping gallery with mattresses provided, a sitting area with wood-burning stove, two bathrooms with hot showers and a fully-equipped kitchen including gas rings and microwave. In summer, enjoy your meals in the conservatory. There's a pool room with darts and table tennis.
properties.address: Middle Beardshaw Farm, Burnley Road, Trawden, Lancashire

properties.name: YHA Treyarnon
properties.description: YHA Treyarnon is a cosy retreat for a cheap family holiday at any time of year. Virtually on the beach, its location is an ideal setting for summer surfing and activity breaks or wind-swept winter walking holidays. Roaring log fires in the colder months provide a warm welcome, with the beach and coastal paths for those warmer days.
properties.address: Tregonnan, Treyarnon, Padstow, Cornwall, PL28 8JR

properties.name: YHA Truleigh Hill
properties.description: If you're looking for walking and cycling holidays or family activity breaks, this comfortable and convenient hostel on the South Downs Way is ideal. YHA Truleigh is great for school trips too, away from it all, but close to civilisation.
properties.address: Tottington Barn, Shoreham-by-Sea, West Sussex, BN43 5FB

properties.name: YHA Tyncornel Bunkhouse
properties.description: Peace and quiet are guaranteed at this simple but comfortable hostel in the beautiful, remote Doethie valley. Relax in the cosy sitting room with its open fire.
properties.address: Llanddewi-Brefi, Tregaron, Ceredigion, SY25 6PH

properties.name: Underbank Camping Barn
properties.description: This barn is part of Blaze Farm, a dairy farm near the western edge of the Peak District National Park. It overlooks the Wildboarclough Valley and is close to the well known viewpoint of Shuttlingsloe. The sleeping area is on the first floor, with the living area, kitchen, toilet and shower below. Blaze Farm has an ice-cream parlour and tea room for snacks or you can pre-order breakfast to set you up for the day.
properties.address: Blaze Farm, Wildboarclough, Macclesfield, Cheshire

properties.name: YHA Wasdale Hall
properties.description: Perfectly located for all the classic Lakeland activities, this National Trust owned building is a comfortable rural retreat on the lake shore, perfect to relax in after your outdoor activity holiday. There's excellent catering available to refuel you after a day walking, hiking or climbing the hills.
properties.address: Wasdale Hall, Wasdale, Seascale, Cumbria, CA20 1ET

properties.name: Waterslacks Camping Barn
properties.description: Waterslacks Camping Barn is a traditional stone field barn that has been thoughtfully converted into basic accommodation. It has a secluded location on the edge of the steep-sided Manifold Valley and enjoys stunning views of the surrounding hills. It is a great experience for those who enjoy getting back to nature, or don't mind roughing it.
properties.address: Wetton Road, Butterton, Nr. Leek, Staffordshire

properties.name: YHA Wells-next-the-Sea
properties.description: A comfy self-catering hostel in an historic fishing town. The hostel is within easy reach of the National Nature Reserves at Blakeney Point, Cley Marches, Titchwell and Pensthorpe - ideal for your Norfolk activity break. That’s just for starters – there’s something for everyone in this excellent location, including great routes for walking holidays and lovely beaches for a weekend seaside break.
properties.address: Church Plain, Wells, Norfolk, NR23 1EQ

properties.name: YHA Whitby
properties.description: This family-friendly hostel is in a stunning location, near to the abbey ruins, and overlooking the bustling town of Whitby, making it great for a cheap seaside break. The hostel is great for school trips and activity breaks as well, there's so much to do! Lovely beaches, a fascinating museum and access to the wonderful North Yorkshire Moors, what more could you want on your Yorkshire coast family break?
properties.address: Abbey House, East Cliff, Whitby, North Yorkshire, YO22 4JT

properties.name: YHA Wilderhope Manor
properties.description: Stay in a listed Elizabethan manor, with ornate ceilings, oak spiral staircases and panelled rooms - the perfect backdrop for your civil wedding ceremony! The hostel is close to the famous Ironbridge Gorge and gives good access to the lovely River Severn and Shropshire hills for activity breaks.
properties.address: Longville in the Dale, Shropshire, TF13 6EG

properties.name: Wills Camping Barn
properties.description:
Wills Barn is a short walk out of Butterton Village and lies beside the minor road between Butterton and Wetton Mill. The Manifold and Dove Valleys are nearby. A secluded base from which to enjoy the limestone valleys and delightful villages of the southern Peak District. The Manifold Valley cycle track is close by, and Alton
Towers is just a twenty minute drive away.
properties.address: Wetton Road, Butterton, Nr. Leek, Staffordshire

properties.name: YHA Windermere
properties.description: Enjoy panoramic views of the mountains and spectacular sunsets over Lake Windermere. If you’re feeling energetic, don’t miss the walk over Wansfell for stunning views of the lake, or simply relax on the hostel terrace and take in the breathtaking scenery.
properties.address: Bridge Lane, Troutbeck, Windermere, Cumbria, LA23 1LA

properties.name: YHA Woody's Top
properties.description: A very quiet, hidden away hostel, great for walking, cycling and exploring the landscape of the Lincolnshire Wolds.
properties.address: Ruckland, Louth, Lincolnshire, LN11 8RQ

properties.name: YHA Wooler & Shepherds Huts
properties.description: Artistically situated at the foot of the Cheviot Hills, YHA Wooler is perfect for Northumberland walking holidays and other activity breaks, with its beautiful valleys and sweeping panoramic views. If you enjoy bird-watching, look out for puffins on a trip to the Farne Islands or see what you can spot in the Cheviots - don’t forget your binoculars!
properties.address: 30 Cheviot Street, Wooler, Northumberland, NE71 6LW

properties.name: YHA Wye Valley
properties.description: An idyllic riverside location in the heart of the Royal Forest of Dean, great for family weekend breaks and school trips. Close to the famous Symonds Yat rock, the hostel is well set up for activity breaks or school trips, boasting its own canoe landing spot and direct access to miles of cycleways and footpaths for orienteering holidays and walking holidays.
properties.address: Near Goodrich, Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire, HR9 6JJ

properties.name: YHA York
properties.description: Standing in its own spacious grounds, this Youth Hostel in York provides the perfect base for a cheap weekend break. Explore the beautiful historic city, with its world class attractions, shops, restaurants and mediaeval streets, all clustered together within the city walls and below the imposing York Minster. An attractive Victorian hostel providing cheap accommodation close to York city centre.
properties.address: Water End, Clifton, York, North Yorkshire, YO30 6LP

properties.name: YHA Youlgreave
properties.description: Friendly and homely, YHA Youlgreave was once the old village co-op store. Surrounded by stunning scenery in the heart of the Peak District, there’s plenty to see and do for family and activity breaks. The area has some great walks, treks and trails to explore - perfect for walking, cycling and climbing holidays.
properties.address: Fountain Square, Youlgreave, near Bakewell, Derbyshire, DE45 1UR
